intro: Stachytarpheta cayennensis f. purpurea, commonly known as purple bush sage, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact shrub form with lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the variety. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
